item.description:
TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW!  Email me directly (jmmoran@nycap.rr.com) with any questions!  - Julie.


EVENT ORGANIZER: 

Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). You can send text messages to me as well.

 

Difficulty:

1.  White Cap, North Kennebago Divide:  About a five-mile hike, about 1,911 Feet Elevation Change;  this is about three-hour hike.  

2.  Boundary Peak:  About four miles, roughly a 2-3/4-hour hike.

 

Car Spot Meetup Time,  Maine Roadhouse: 7 a.m.

Trailhead Start Time (White Cap, North Kennebago Divide): About 8:30 a.m. 

Trailhead Start Time (Boundary Peak): About two p.m.


LINK TO GOOGLE MAPS (CLICK HERE) -- Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the meetup location to the end of the logging road route below the col in-between the two NEHH summits, White Cap and (North) Kennebago Divide; then to the logging road in Quebec below Boundary Peak.

 

ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light / head lamp, food / snacks / water, first aid items, sun screen, cell phone, camera.  Bring extra layers as temps are heading down this weekend; expect summit temps to approach 35-45 degrees F.  DON'T FORGET YOUR PASSPORT!


NARRATIVE AND UPDATES (09-15-2011 1:30 pm):  

Sorry for the late notice on this hike ... With my move to Vermont, starting a new job in getting in home ready, things have been a little crazy here!

I'm having fun picking off the last few remaining new England Hundred Highest peaks along with my new friend Ed.  This is another romp in the Maine's Western Mountains, including Boundary Peak that is best accessed from the Quebec side of the border, in the Mt. Orford park.  Pleasant logging roads with new fall foliage and flowers will give way to scratchy spruce trees, older and more fragrant as we ascend.  You'll see the historical border survey markings that delineate the U.S.-Canada border as well.  Be sure to review all the information links below.

This trip is in conjunction with a hike up nearby Mt. Abraham the following day.  My plan is that we will rendezvous at the Maine Roadhouse (or the Stratton Motel up the road, if you prefer) and leave as early as we can (if you are driving up morning of the trip, please let me know).  Hope you can join us ... wherever you are headed in the mountains, the weather looks great for this weekend!


NOTE:  Great weather is (finally!) predicted ... however, if weather reports change to unfavorable, I WILL RESCHEDULE. Also, all my hikes are dog friendly (and Mike will be coming!) -- if you don't like dogs, don't come.

[LINK] What documentation do I need to bring my dog to Canada?


Boundary Monument 446 features interesting construction ... Originally put in place in 1842 by the joint surveying parties from the US and Canada, it is a three-foot-high metal monument in a concrete base.

 


MAPS, TRIP PLANS AND RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:


INFORMATION LINK (Overview, New England Hundred Highest):   SummitPost

INFORMATION LINK:  Maine Roadhouse

 

INFORMATION LINK (White Cap and NKD):   "Papa Bear"

INFORMATION LINK (White Cap):   FranklinSites.com

INFORMATION LINK (NKD):   FranklinSites.com

INFORMATION LINK (White Cap and NKD):   Bob & Geri's Adventures

INFORMATION LINK (White Cap and NKD):   NHMountainHiking.com


INFORMATION LINK (Boundary Peak):   "Papa Bear" (Winter)

INFORMATION LINK (Boundary Peak):   "Papa Bear" (Summer)

INFORMATION LINK (Boundary Peak):   FranklinSites.com

INFORMATION LINK (Boundary Peak):   Bob & Geri's Adventures

INFORMATION LINK (Boundary Peak):   NHMountainHiking.com

INFORMATION LINK (Boundary Peak):   Map of the Mt. Orford area (.PDF)


WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY OF MY HIKING EVENTS.

SEE YOU THERE! Julie and Mike 

 

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the following:  If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.  Full waiver can be found elsewhere on this site.  THANK YOU FOR UNDERSTANDING AND FOR HIKING SAFE!
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: MAINE (NEHH) SERIES: White Cap, North Kennebago Divide and Boundary Peak
